name: Chop Suey
description:
A nice, off-the-beaten-path canyon with multi-colored layers of rock and a few sections with shallow narrows.

Approach

Park at Bull Pen TH and hike WCC trail to Blodgett trail to the head of the canyon, entering via a side drainage.

Or drive Cedar Flat Road and park at the 90 degree left turn and then hike south into the canyon from there. This option requires a shuttle from Bull Pen TH.

Descent

R1: 70' from a cairn.

Enter the main drainage and boulder hop until reaching the sandstone layer.

R2: 20' from a rock pinch into a shallow pool.

A number of other short drops pop up and can be bypassed or downclimbed.

R3: 40' from a rock chock in a crack RDC at the edge of the drop.

Exit

Hike WCC trail back to Bull Pen TH.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

First descent by Melissa Philibeck and Garrett Bennett in winter of 2011.
